FuncDef:
The mpls command enables MPLS on an interface.
The undo mpls command disables MPLS on an interface.
This command varies in transport and router modes. For detailed differences, see Differences Between Commands in Transport and Router Modes. This topic describes the command configuration in router mode.
By default, MPLS is not enabled on an interface.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
On a network where MPLS services are deployed, after you enable MPLS on a node, enable MPLS on the interfaces of the node to perform other MPLS configurations.
Prerequisites
MPLS has been enabled globally using the mpls command in the system view.
Follow-up Procedure
You can perform other MPLS configurations.
Precautions
Running the undo mpls command in the interface view causes the deletion of all MPLS configurations on the interface.
